channel.title: BBC News - Wales

item.title: Covid-19 death toll passes 8,000 mark in Wales
item.description: There have been 8,002 deaths involving Covid in Wales since the pandemic began, figures show.

item.title: Drugs: How a county lines gang moved into Newtown
item.description: Joy Jones's quiet cul-de-sac became home to drug dealers and their customers.

item.title: Lorry hits bridge in Machynlleth, closing A487 and railway
item.description: Traffic Wales says motorists should plan ahead as the road is expected to be closed for some time.

item.title: Cardiff stabbing: Two bailed and one released without charge
item.description: The man was seriously injured in the incident in Callaghan Square in Cardiff, on Saturday.

item.title: Logan Mwangi: Cause of death not yet known, inquest hears
item.description: Inquest opens into death of five-year-old Logan Mwangi's whose body was found in a river by police.

item.title: Hospitality: Plea to allow outdoor seating after Gwynedd Council ban
item.description: Dining marquees are taking up parking spaces and the council says others have complained.

item.title: Companies House rejects 800 potentially offensive names
item.description: More than 800 company names have been rejected over the past two years.

item.title: Covid in Wales: Ministers consider U-turn on private travel tests
item.description: A ban on travellers using non-NHS coronavirus tests could be scrapped by the Welsh government.

item.title: Anglesey sea defence plans branded 'environmental vandalism'
item.description: Three councillors say works would cause "irreparable damage" to a beach.

item.title: JoJo Maman Bebe hikes prices for first time in 5 years
item.description: The baby goods retailer tells the BBC that it has raised prices for the first time in five years.

item.title: David Smith retains individual boccia title
item.description: Britain's David Smith likens himself to footballer Cristiano Ronaldo as he retains his Paralympic boccia individual title.

item.title: BBC and Creative Wales partnership to boost Welsh TV industry
item.description: The BBC and Creative Wales announce a partnership to support making world-class Welsh shows.

item.title: Drugs: The county lines gang in our Powys cul-de-sac
item.description: What happens when drug dealers move in to a small, rural town?

item.title: Climate change: Meet the people taking action
item.description: A goods swap shop and DIY flood defenders are just some ideas people have put into practice.

item.title: Covid: The doctor busting Covid vaccine myths on social media
item.description: Dr Bnar Talabani has been trying to encourage young people on TikTok to get jabbed.

item.title: Rugby: Mixed ability club in Llanelli marks 25 years
item.description: About half of the club's players are registered disabled and most have learning disabilities.

item.title: Stormzy, Skepta and Aitch: Making beats for rap stars at 19
item.description: Chris Rich has made thousands from creating beats in the style of hip hop's elite.

item.title: Payday lenders: 'They are robbing the vulnerable'
item.description: Within months of his first £150 payday loan, Tom owed £6,000 to 10 lenders.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Will Bayley and Paul Karabardak reach table tennis final
item.description: Watch GB's Will Bayley and Paul Karabardak celebrate reaching the final of the men's class 6-7 table tennis after a tense win against Spain.

item.title: Injury-hit Wales without host of players for Finland friendly in Helsinki
item.description: Wales will be severely depleted for Wednesday's friendly in Finland after being hit by a spate of withdrawals.

item.title: Cory Hill: Wales lock joins Yokohama Canon Eagles
item.description: Japan side Yokohama Canon Eagles confirm the signing of Wales second row Cory Hill.

item.title: World Cup 2022 qualifiers - all you need to know about September's games
item.description: BBC Sport gives the lowdown on the state of play in qualifying for the 2022 World Cup and what to look out for in this international break.

item.title: Swansea City sign French midfielder Olivier Ntcham
item.description: Swansea City sign French midfielder Olivier Ntcham on a three-year deal following his departure from Celtic.

item.title: Llywodraeth Cymru yn ystyried newid rheolau profion teithio
item.description: Ar hyn o bryd mae'n rhaid i deithwyr Cymreig ddefnyddio profion £68 y GIG neu wynebu dirwy o £1,000.

item.title: COP26 yn 'gwbl dyngedfennol' i ddyfodol y blaned
item.description: Gwyddonydd blaenllaw yn dweud bod osgoi newid hinsawdd sylweddol bellach yn "dasg hynod o anodd".

item.title: Oedi wrth i lori daro pont reilffordd ym Machynlleth
item.description: Cafodd yr heol a lein y rheilffordd eu cau wrth i'r cerbyd daro yn erbyn pont y rheilffordd.

item.title: 300fed gêm i un o Ryfelwyr Llanelli
item.description: Gwilym Lewis sydd newydd chwarae ei 300fed gêm i Ryfelwyr Llanelli wrth iddynt ddathlu 25 mlynedd

item.title: Morgannwg yn colli ar fore'r trydydd diwrnod
item.description: Cricedwyr Morgannwg yn cael eu chwalu gan Essex ym Mhencampwriaeth y Siroedd.
